positive.review:
This only gets a thumbs up because of all the fun I had when friends still played this game, but unfortunately this went the way of the West when The Powers That Be decided that a roleplaying experience was less lucrative than making GTA forever. Surprised they haven't just pulled the plug already since this is clearly not something anyone in charge gives an ess eche eye tee about. Unplayable without a third party tool that dumps you in a session alone, and just makes me sad to even do that now that everyone has moved on. I had to move on. The world turns, and the vast, beautiful landscape falls silent as gunfighters, thieves, rogues and heroes hang up their belts and vanish.

Playing now feels like walking through the empty hallways of a place you used to know before a bomb went off in it. It's like seeing one of your loved ones in a hospital bed waiting for their instinctual breathing to cease after their life support is shut off. Looking at a photo of your family as it burns up in your hands.

The Assassination of a Great Time by the Coward Rockstar Games.

I love Red dead redemption 2 and this is almost as good. Story could be a bit longer on this one. It's much more amazing if you play it with a posse of your own! 9/10 just grind it <3

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â˜† | A Beautiful but Chaotic Frontier

Red Dead Online is one of the most immersive online worlds you can step into. Its questlines are fun and full of character, and the world itself is stunningâ€”wide-open plains, peaceful forests, snowy mountains, all brought to life with incredible detail. Just exploring can feel like its own reward.

But the game has a rough side too. Cheating is unfortunately common, especially during multiplayer events. You might run into players teleporting, spawning explosions, or using invincibility to ruin the fun. It can definitely break the experience at times.

Still, RDOâ€™s community is a strange mix of chaos and kindness. Youâ€™ll even meet â€œfriendly cheatersâ€ who use their powers to help instead of harmâ€”spawning loot, clearing missions, or defending others from trolls.

Overall, Red Dead Online is a beautiful game with pretty decent quests and atmosphere. The cheating problem is real, but if you can look past it, thereâ€™s still a lot of adventure and charm to enjoy.
Red Dead Online has a beautiful open world and fun roles to play, but itâ€™s very slow-paced and can feel grindy. Great with friends, enjoyable if you like exploring, but lacks big updates. 7/10
this game is so fun and i like that there are different types of games its good for kids i play with my dad or by myself and im only 10 ive played this game since i was 5

Red Dead Redemption 2 Online â€“ 5/5 Stars: â€œMy Horse is Eastern European and Judging Me.â€

I logged into the Wild West expecting cowboy gloryâ€¦ instead Iâ€™m now a full-time tarot card delivery boy for Madame â€œI-Forgot-Her-Nameâ€ (Nazar, apparently, but she moves every five minutes like she owes the taxman money).

My horse, Pascu, is supposed to be a war horseâ€¦ Romanian roots, strong like vampire garlic farmer. In reality, heâ€™s built like a tank but trips over air if a tumbleweed looks at him funny. Anytime danger shows up, Pascu transforms from â€œBattle Steed of the Balkansâ€ into â€œScreaming Potatoes With Legs.â€

Gameplay Loop:

Locate tarot cards

Curse Madame Whats-Her-Name for making me run halfway across the continent

Watch Pascu sprint full speed into a cliff

Profit (likeâ€¦ $4)

Highlights:

Shot at by five outlaws â†’ Pascu bravely yeets himself into a river to â€œflee strategicallyâ€

Tried to lasso a fleeing NPC â†’ lassoed Pascu instead

Gave Pascu fancy grooming â†’ immediately rolled in mud like Swamp Goblin

Immersion level: astonishing
Self-respect level: missing since tutorial

Would I recommend?
Absolutely. If youâ€™ve ever wanted to role-play as a discount fortune-telling Romanian horse dad with crippling debt to a traveling antique dealer who never smiles â€“ this is your moment.

10/10, Pascu still refuses to stop eating random plants.

Red Dead Redemption 2 is a beautiful game that offers alot.  I enjoyed the single player version, and online on xboxX.  That said.... Do NOT purchase Red Dead online 2 on PC.  Every server is filled with players that use Mods which break the game.  The animals will vanish, the NPCs and Quests will not work. You will not be able to enjoy it.  I spent 4 hours with my family server hoping to find one server that worked/was not being hacked in random strange ways and was unsuccessful.  Seriously, do not buy RDR2 online.  You have been honestly warned. This is the first review I have ever left and own 90+ games with thousands of hours of play.

The Game is bugged as hell, you can suddenly teleport somewhere and loose all your loot, or get blown to pieces randomly or set on fire in the water.... There are so much bugs and so much hackers that the game feels almost unplayable. The animals often doesn't spawn, you have to switch servers multiple times to get animals to actually spawn. I wanted to report these bugs but for the love of this game Rockstar makes it so hard for me to report an issue, I tried navigating to their website but would get suddenly shifted to GTA V articles, or other articles. It's as if Rockstar doesn't want to hear your complaints. A billion dollar company doesn't have a running customer service line that says it's 24/7, either they're lying corporate weasels or they just hired the wrong design team to make a customer service option. I really wanna love this game i do, but the bugs makes the game so frustrating.

Red Dead Redemption 2 â€” the story and gameplay in that game are super perfect, but its online version is really the worst. There are so many bugs that if you start the game calmly, youâ€™ll definitely get irritated and end up uninstalling it. Thatâ€™s how bad the bugs are. For example: if you interact with a shop or something in the game, the camera just freezes and you canâ€™t do anything. Sometimes the horse doesnâ€™t move. Sometimes NPC characters donâ€™t move. Fast travel sometimes doesnâ€™t work properly and you donâ€™t even get the rewards after finishing missions.

The worst thing is the cheaters. There are cheaters who you canâ€™t do anything about â€” they can even crash your game. Sure, you can report them to Rockstar and expect them to take action, but from my experience, that doesnâ€™t happen. I reported maybe 150+ cheaters and nothing changed. My friend list is full of cheaters â€” they roam around freely and nothing stops them. Iâ€™ve even spent real money saving up for Rockstarâ€™s gold packs, only to see cheaters get unlimited gold through hacks. It frustrates me so much. This game is garbage.

Even if youâ€™re on a good network, the sessions change randomly. You might have a stable session only rarely; most times you get unpredictable errors and itâ€™s impossible to play peacefully. If you try to be calm and just explore, the game suddenly kicks you out with an error â€” thatâ€™s really stressful. I wanted to play to relax, but instead I get stressed. Iâ€™ve uninstalled this game more than 13 times; now this is the 14th time Iâ€™m about to uninstall it. There are still many other problems I could list, but Iâ€™ve said enough. If you buy this game, congrats!

I mean, great game.... but a little messy. They updated the animal system, now if you have any hunting roles, you're pretty much out of luck. Spawns for animals are extremely sparse. Now, Bounty hunting used to be a great way to earn some cash and gold, but a few years back they updated it to provide less to  push players to buy gold. More than likely, you'll be in a server with a hacker who may just spawn all players to a location and freeze their movements so they can grind kills (Happens a lot). Servers are pretty stuttery now. Has a lot of potential, don't get me wrong, but from what we've seen from the developers so far, this game isn't getting any better, just worse. If a pizza place delivered you a pizza missing the sauce or cheese, you'd think you could get a refund, but any of us that bought it years ago basically got skimmed, well, those of use that aren't modding. NGL the modders look like they're having a lot of fun.
Unacceptably buggy for how old this game and the bugs are. Some of these are really egregious too like missions not loading. Rockstar makes absolute trash.

this game is so beautiful if you manage to find a server that lets you play it. hackers make this game unplayable. needing to jump servers constantly to avoid griefers and the inevitable mission bugs is incredibly time consuming. i really like this game, the graphics and gameplay are gorgeous, but my god Rockstar need to implement strategies to moderate it.
don't spend your money on this.

Went from console to PC, returned to the game years later.

You put in your time, you get crashes/bugs/griefing back that limit your experience. No updates or staff presence. Quality of life is low in my opinion. Cannot get the peace and immersion from it that I expected.

You can tell this game was made specifically Like a full time job: TL/DR - A Grind fest of Mirco-transactions in a modded hell of an experience. 

I used to play GTA online Back in 2016/17 and grinded money back than - I hated the entire experience however the rewards were worth it - When I got to RDO Beta I grinded like crazy to get as much currency as I could for future updates like I did in GTA online - However I ended up quitting, was nothing to do past Missions. 

Fast Forward to 2023 - Downloaded RDO played it in solo lobby(Because of hearing about all the modder hell that was going on in the game) I ended up grinding past my pervious character and completed all the roles.... at which point nothing was worth buying - No Gattling Gun Wagons - No Train robberies - No Bank Robberies - No Legendary Horses - Nothing is worth the grind, and to make matters worst your grind which you have to maximize your profits is based upon how long you are in the mission - Their is only a few Missions in which you get a flat rate for your troubles - NONE of which have gold - Gold is all RNG/Timed play. 

I go back to GTA online and started that again, realised that they mitigated that grind for money in the game for the experience of having fun - which the game should have been in the first place. I than start thinking about it and now I see RDO as it is a Mobile version of GTA online without any of the fun factors - It is so close but not close enough to say that playing online should require you to give them your banking information and you have to dodge and weave Splashscreens with button presses from them taking funds out of your account, because that is all this game is... What do you truly get out of your grind... outfits and Emotes.... that's about it. 

You cannot save RDO without removing GOLD and The Timed quest payouts, which rockstar will never do - It's also funny that they have these MTX's when you have TO PAY FOR THIS VERSION - It should be free.  There is nothing in this game to do after completing the roles - unless you want to wait out for the FOMO(yes you heard that right) events which only give you... Cosmetics and Emotes - What's the point - so you can go into a lobby with those emotes to try out only to be teleported in the air and blown up over and over again? That's what your end game is all about - getting stuff you can't use unless you just want your character to flip you off over and over again. 

This version should be Delisted as the game is abandoned - Buy Red Dead Redemption 2 when it's on sale - Play the online on that version get your achievements and never come back - this game is designed to just take your money and give you nothing in return - it's a shame because it's a beautiful game with so much potential... Oh well Lesson learned I suppose.

save yourself the time and effort and just get in on console. this game is infinitely worse on pc, thanks to hackers and general third party rockstar crap. i have 800+ hours on console, love the game but i can't get passed 5 hours on pc due to various things constantly screwing up or hackers ruining sessions.

Everyone uses mods and you will have the worst time because of it. You can be in the middle of a shoot out only to be teleported into someone's moonshine shack where someone rapes you because that is an actual mod that is used now. Rockstar wont do a single thing about it. You can be ridding your horse between towns and a UFO will come down and wreck your game. Saves will become busted, your new pc will practiclly catch fire cause you are now playing in a damaged  server. 

More people in the server, the less animals spawn, you wanna hunt? Fish? trade? or have random encounters? Wont happen if there is more then ten people on the map. Instead you will have someone steal all your gold via hack, kill all your horses, and then follow you from server to server.

It sucks cause I WANT to love this game so bad. Its fun when it works and I'm placed in a server by myself. But Rockstar abandoned it and its nearly impossible to play now. Get it if its on sale if you want.

Red Dead Redemption 2 â€” the story and gameplay in that game are super perfect, but its online version is really the worst. There are so many bugs that if you start the game calmly, youâ€™ll definitely get irritated and end up uninstalling it. Thatâ€™s how bad the bugs are. For example: if you interact with a shop or something in the game, the camera just freezes and you canâ€™t do anything. Sometimes the horse doesnâ€™t move. Sometimes NPC characters donâ€™t move. Fast travel sometimes doesnâ€™t work properly and you donâ€™t even get the rewards after finishing missions.

The worst thing is the cheaters. There are cheaters who you canâ€™t do anything about â€” they can even crash your game. Sure, you can report them to Rockstar and expect them to take action, but from my experience, that doesnâ€™t happen. I reported maybe 150+ cheaters and nothing changed. My friend list is full of cheaters â€” they roam around freely and nothing stops them. Iâ€™ve even spent real money saving up for Rockstarâ€™s gold packs, only to see cheaters get unlimited gold through hacks. It frustrates me so much. This game is garbage.

Even if youâ€™re on a good network, the sessions change randomly. You might have a stable session only rarely; most times you get unpredictable errors and itâ€™s impossible to play peacefully. If you try to be calm and just explore, the game suddenly kicks you out with an error â€” thatâ€™s really stressful. I wanted to play to relax, but instead I get stressed. Iâ€™ve uninstalled this game more than 13 times; now this is the 14th time Iâ€™m about to uninstall it. There are still many other problems I could list, but Iâ€™ve said enough. If you buy this game, congrats!

classic Rockstar multiplayer netcode. If you love GTAV's infinite load screens (not due to HDD/SSD or your network/isp) and "freezing" when exiting NPC interaction menus, you'll love this game. ("freezing" as in all i could do was open the map and ALT F4, which proved the game was not frozen because the game asked if i really wanted to exit the game. straight rockstar bs)

but hey, at least they fixed the stables so you can actually enter them after the year(s) of that bug existing. (the NPC freezing was also caused by the stables..... i was able to enter, buy things, but never leave. saw another review, ig this bug is consistent)

This game feels fully abandoned. It's super buggy, and upon looking up answers for the bugs, they are bugs that have been around for years with no fix. And they aren't little bugs (such as getting a random hat stuck on your head) but big bugs like getting completely stuck every time you try to exit the horse stable. Requires a full forced quit and reload, but it will just happen again next time you try. And those aren't the only bugs I have encountered in such a small amount of game time. Disappointing when RDR2 is such a hyped and amazing game.

Red Dead Redemption 2 is a beautiful game that offers alot.  I enjoyed the single player version, and online on xboxX.  That said.... Do NOT purchase Red Dead online 2 on PC.  Every server is filled with players that use Mods which break the game.  The animals will vanish, the NPCs and Quests will not work. You will not be able to enjoy it.  I spent 4 hours with my family server hoping to find one server that worked/was not being hacked in random strange ways and was unsuccessful.  Seriously, do not buy RDR2 online.  You have been honestly warned. This is the first review I have ever left and own 90+ games with thousands of hours of play.
